summary: The Child Care and Development Fund provides grants to states to subsidize child care for low-income families. Congress gave this program an extra $52 billion in FYs 2020 and 2021 to help with the COVID-19 pandemic . We talked to state officials that help administer this program in 5 states: Michigan, Nevada, New Mexico, New York, and Tennessee. They told us that they used this...
title: Child Care: Selected States Are Taking Steps to Sustain Program Changes Implemented with COVID-19 Funding
